H.content: p. anne 34 Derrida risks a discourse where nothing is planned, risks misunderstanding
H.linkedContent: p. anne 34 Derrida risks a discourse where nothing is planned, risks misunderstanding

POR.content: “thinking” requires both principle of reason and what’s beyond it, both archē and an-archy > decision [of thought] always risks the worst, to claim to erase the risk by institutional program is to create a barricade against a future
POR.linkedContent: “thinking” requires both principle of reason and what’s beyond it, both archē and an-archy > decision [of thought] always risks the worst, to claim to erase the risk by institutional program is to create a barricade against a future

MPM.content: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”

VM.content: text “run[s] the risk of being definitively lost, who will ever know of such disappearances?”
VM.linkedContent: text “run[s] the risk of being definitively lost, who will ever know of such disappearances?”

PAS.content: Blanchot’s viens, not a command, the price to pay, risk, to think hors la langue
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s viens, not a command, the price to pay, risk, to think hors la langue

SH.content: poem, in offering itself, risks losing its time and place to the holocaustic generality of recurrence and readability of concept
SH.linkedContent: poem, in offering itself, risks losing its time and place to the holocaustic generality of recurrence and readability of concept

FWT.content: heritage not only a double injunction or reaffirmation but a choice, filtering, heir not only receives but is one who risks choosing
FWT.linkedContent: heritage not only a double injunction or reaffirmation but a choice, filtering, heir not only receives but is one who risks choosing

FWT.content: risk decision by enduring undecidable: 2 contradictory imperatives
one should never want to avoid getting caught in a tight spot [re: “Christian” landscape of deconstruction]
FWT.linkedContent: one should never want to avoid getting caught in a tight spot [re: “Christian” landscape of deconstruction]

POOF.content: the risk of the perhaps and its already, we’ve undergone it, we have it in memory: ce déjà [Derrida]du peut-être
POOF.linkedContent: the risk of the perhaps and its already, we’ve undergone it, we have it in memory: ce déjà [Derrida]du peut-être

POOF.content: the hyperbole of this friendship seems to engage w/ greatest risk (re: inherited concept of friendship) when Nietzsche speaks of ‘w/out sharing,’ ‘w/out reciprocity’ > can one, then, still speak of equality & fraternity?
POOF.linkedContent: the hyperbole of this friendship seems to engage w/ greatest risk (re: inherited concept of friendship) when Nietzsche speaks of ‘w/out sharing,’ ‘w/out reciprocity’ > can one, then, still speak of equality & fraternity?

POOF.content: desire in lovence (friendship or love) engages me w/ a particular him or her, a singular ‘who,’ desire of the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance (nécessairement infranchissable), where a politics of lovence would no longer imply motifs of community, which always risks bringing a brother back > risk must still be assumed to keep question of ‘who’ from being politically enframed (arraisonner) by schema of l'être-commun
POOF.linkedContent: desire in lovence (friendship or love) engages me w/ a particular him or her, a singular ‘who,’ desire of the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance (nécessairement infranchissable), where a politics of lovence would no longer imply motifs of community, which always risks bringing a brother back > risk must still be assumed to keep question of ‘who’ from being politically enframed (arraisonner) by schema of l'être-commun

POS.content: if one does not develop a systematic strategy of deconstruction, textual irruptions risk falling into excess, into empirical experiments, or into classical metaphysics > but certain risks must be run [re: problematic first re: his own writing on “history of philosophy”]
POS.linkedContent: if one does not develop a systematic strategy of deconstruction, textual irruptions risk falling into excess, into empirical experiments, or into classical metaphysics > but certain risks must be run [re: problematic first re: his own writing on “history of philosophy”]

P.content: wanting to avoid “repetition” at all costs, one can: rush toward false exit, empirical chit-chat (bavardage), spring-green impulsive avant-gardism (l’avant-gardism printanier ou primesautier)
P.linkedContent: wanting to avoid “repetition” at all costs, one can: rush toward false exit, empirical chit-chat (bavardage), spring-green impulsive avant-gardism (l’avant-gardism printanier ou primesautier)

P.content: who said it was necessary to avoid risk of “repetition”?
P.linkedContent: who said it was necessary to avoid risk of “repetition”?

ROP.content: Foucault pulls back from (admits impasses of) epistēmē > mais seul ceux qui travaillent, seuls ceux qui prennent des risques en travaillant rencontrent des difficultés > responsibility dans l’épreuve de l’aporie
ROP.linkedContent: Foucault pulls back from (admits impasses of) epistēmē > mais seul ceux qui travaillent, seuls ceux qui prennent des risques en travaillant rencontrent des difficultés > responsibility dans l’épreuve de l’aporie

GSP.content: in writing, sign can always “empty” itself, may never be reactivated, risks remaining forever closed & mute
GSP.linkedContent: in writing, sign can always “empty” itself, may never be reactivated, risks remaining forever closed & mute

PS.content: Western theater is decadent because it has broken away from Danger: Artaud, like Nietzsche, but via theater, wants to return us to Danger as Becoming
PS.linkedContent: Western theater is decadent because it has broken away from Danger: Artaud, like Nietzsche, but via theater, wants to return us to Danger as Becoming

O.content: dissemination blows up (saute) security of point, arrested in name of the law: it is at the risk, to risk this blowup (to make this jump, faire sauter) that dissem. broaches/has been broached
O.linkedContent: dissemination blows up (saute) security of point, arrested in name of the law: it is at the risk, to risk this blowup (to make this jump, faire sauter) that dissem. broaches/has been broached

RGE.content: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse
RGE.linkedContent: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse

RGE.content: Hegel’s master/slave an economy of life [vs. economy of death]
rush headlong into death to risk absolute loss of meaning [Aufhebung cancels this risk]
RGE.linkedContent: rush headlong into death to risk absolute loss of meaning [Aufhebung cancels this risk]

RGE.content: figure of experience that mimes through sacrifice the risk of absolute death, the feint through which the risk can be lived; philosophy can’t think this simulacrum, Bataille can only say it, feign to say it, in the Hegelian logos > ce rire qui se confond, dans le simulacre, avec l’ouverture du sacré
RGE.linkedContent: figure of experience that mimes through sacrifice the risk of absolute death, the feint through which the risk can be lived; philosophy can’t think this simulacrum, Bataille can only say it, feign to say it, in the Hegelian logos > ce rire qui se confond, dans le simulacre, avec l’ouverture du sacré

RGE.content: in order to save what does not want to be saved (silence, play, absolute risk), must redouble language, must have recourse to strategies, ruses, simulacra, masks
RGE.linkedContent: in order to save what does not want to be saved (silence, play, absolute risk), must redouble language, must have recourse to strategies, ruses, simulacra, masks

RGE.content: Bataille’s communication, only btwn beings who have put the being w/in themselves at stake (mis en jeu) > “placé à la limite de la mort, du néant”
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille’s communication, only btwn beings who have put the being w/in themselves at stake (mis en jeu) > “placé à la limite de la mort, du néant”

DST.content: thinking of translation, experience of thinking itself, its most essential & risky passage, where experience of thinking is also poetic experience: privileged examples (in Lacoue-Labarthe): Gestell, mimesis, rhuthmos
DST.linkedContent: thinking of translation, experience of thinking itself, its most essential & risky passage, where experience of thinking is also poetic experience: privileged examples (in Lacoue-Labarthe): Gestell, mimesis, rhuthmos

DST.content: quotation marks: vigilant circumspection, insurance against all risks [in this case Lacoue-Labarthe continually exposes himself to these risks]
DST.linkedContent: quotation marks: vigilant circumspection, insurance against all risks [in this case Lacoue-Labarthe continually exposes himself to these risks]

EJQB.content: poem would be nothing w/out risk of being meaningless
EJQB.linkedContent: poem would be nothing w/out risk of being meaningless

AFR.content: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself
AFR.linkedContent: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself

AFR.content: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself
AFR.linkedContent: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself

TN.content: singularity [never assured] doit être couru comme une chance ou un risque: Nancy’s a bettor, thinker of the bet (pari), a desperate bettor, never stops staking, committing (d’engager), calculating w/ exactitude hyperbolic odds (gages): not counting on gains (bénéfice) of an “argument du pari” [Pascal] or any salut
TN.linkedContent: singularity [never assured] doit être couru comme une chance ou un risque: Nancy’s a bettor, thinker of the bet (pari), a desperate bettor, never stops staking, committing (d’engager), calculating w/ exactitude hyperbolic odds (gages): not counting on gains (bénéfice) of an “argument du pari” [Pascal] or any salut

TN.content: greatest risk, try to know to “whom,” not about “what,” you’re talking
TN.linkedContent: greatest risk, try to know to “whom,” not about “what,” you’re talking

ATM.content: for Levinas, in search of God uncontaminated by Being, contact is a priori contamination > graver yet: risk of contamination that surfaces before contact, in necessity of tying interruptions together (insistence of ruptures)
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, in search of God uncontaminated by Being, contact is a priori contamination > graver yet: risk of contamination that surfaces before contact, in necessity of tying interruptions together (insistence of ruptures)

ATM.content: contamination is no longer a risk but a fate that must be assumed [from risk to fate]
ATM.linkedContent: contamination is no longer a risk but a fate that must be assumed [from risk to fate]

SPEC.content: woman perpetuates race by risking the name: analytic “movement” as genealogy of son-in-law, Judaic law
SPEC.linkedContent: woman perpetuates race by risking the name: analytic “movement” as genealogy of son-in-law, Judaic law

CHOR.content: phallogocentrism, “patrix,” is insurance against return of that which is feared as most agonizing risk
CHOR.linkedContent: phallogocentrism, “patrix,” is insurance against return of that which is feared as most agonizing risk
